text:
Hi my name is Emmy, and welcome to the Ray 
Dashboard walkthrough series. In this video,

we're going to take a closer look at the Serve 
page for monitoring your Serve applications. When

I arrive at my page here, I see this nice overview 
and summary of the different applications that I

have running along with some time series metrics 
that I have updating in real time with things

that I care about like queries per second (QPS) 
and information regarding latency. Looking at my

application further, I can see useful information 
such as statuses, and I can even click into to see

this application config per application. Let's 
dig into our applications a little further. So

if I click on them, I can get this summary 
table of the deployments and replicas that

are associated with my application. So I can go 
ahead and expand, and see the different replicas.

I can get a deployment config for each of my 
deployments, and for each replica or deployment,

I'm able to click on "Metrics" and that'll 
open up the Grafana UI where I can customize

the different metrics that I'm interested 
in, as well as set different time frames.

Going back here, I'm also able to access the 
logs for my replicas in case I'm doing any sort

of troubleshooting or debugging. That covers the 
key features for Ray Serve in the Dashboard. For

more information, check out the other videos 
in this series, and thanks for watching!
